business.headline: Crashed Dreamliner well-maintained, next major check was due in Dec: Air India CEOAir India CEO Campbell Wilson on Thursday said that the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, that crashed in Ahmedbad on June 12, was well maintained.

GST Council may replace compensation cess with 2 new levies: ReportIf approved, the dual cess structure could redefine how India funds health and green goals, but only if the Centre and states agree on who pays, who gains, and who decides.

Explained: How India's new gold loan rules will impact lendersThe RBI's directive requires a move towards cash flow-based credit assessments. This means lenders must go beyond just considering the gold's value as collateral.

India's rice exports gain edge as Vietnam, Thailand face subdued markets: ReportIndia's rice supply remains strong, with government reserves reported at 59.5 million metric tonnes as of June 1. This figure is over four times the official target for July, highlighting the country's substantial rice stockpile.

Oswal Pumps IPO listing: Will it make a bumper debut? Check latest GMPOswal Pumps is set to debut on Dalal Street on June 19 with high investor expectations. The IPO of Oswal Pumps was oversubscribed by more than 34 times.

Karnataka plans 10-hour days for tech sector employees: ReportAt present, Section 7 of the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, 1961, limits working hours to nine per day, and allows a maximum of 10 hours of overtime in three months.

Your savings account is quietly robbing you, says financial advisorFinancial advisor Lovish Anand has issued a sharp reality check for Indian savers in a recent LinkedIn post titled: "Your Savings Account Is Quietly Robbing You."

Insured, but at what cost?Hospitals are turning into battlegrounds over pending claims, with policyholders watching their premiums shoot up faster than their salaries. Insurance is no longer the comforting shield it once was.

Is Rs 70 lakh per annum the new middle class? Investment banker explainsAre urban professionals struggling even with Rs 70 lakh income per year? A Gurugram-based investment banker breaks down where the money really goes.
Sensex opens flat, Nifty below 24,800; Tech Mahindra shares down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 225.26 points to 81,219.40, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 56.75 points to 24,755.30 as of 9:21 am.

Microsoft to cut thousands of jobs in sales: ReportThe latest round of layoffs follows Microsoft's earlier job cuts in May, which impacted around 6,000 workers across various departments.

Stocks to watch June 19: HDFC Bank, Jio Financial, Hero, Abott, Tata ElxsiWith the US Federal Reserve deciding to keep its key lending rate unchanged, traders and investors in India may react cautiously in today's session.

Air India cuts 15% of international ops till mid-July citing checks, global unrestAir India has temporarily cut 15% of its international widebody flights until mid-July due to Middle East tensions, airspace curfews in Europe and East Asia, and increased safety measures following recent disruptions. This comes after the June 12 Ahmedabad plane crash.

Dassault, Reliance Infrastructure to make Falcon 2000 business jets in IndiaDassault said it aims to deliver the first made-in-India jets by 2028 for corporate and military use, and will cater to rising demand in both Indian and international markets.
Sensex ends 138 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Titan down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 138.64 points to close at 81,444.66, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.35 points to end at 24,812.05.

IPO market heats up with Rs 26,000 crore fundraising in JuneA resurgence in initial public offerings is evident as several major companies plan to launch IPOs in June and July, raising substantial funds.

Explained: Why BSE shares are falling today The drop comes as the company announced a shift in the expiry day of its equity derivative contracts from Tuesdays to Thursdays, effective from September 1, after regulatory approval.

DLF's Rs 11,000 crore Privana North luxury project sells out in a weekSituated in the expansive 116-acre township in Gurugram, this project notched up sales beyond Rs 11,000 crore, highlighting the robust market appetite for premium homes in India's big cities.

Savings account interest rates see sharp drop. Do you really need one?A look into the declining utility of savings accounts as interest rates fall, questioning their role in financial growth and suggesting alternative investment options.

Mule accounts, url masking: How forex trading platform OctaFX scammed investorsThe Enforcement Directorate on June 13 conducted raids at seven locations across four cities, and various incriminating documents and digital devices seized during the operation showed how forex trading platform - OctaFX - cheated investors and generated more than Rs 800 crore in less than a year.

Over 80% jump: The city that outpaced Delhi, Mumbai in property price growthOver the past four years, one city has quietly clocked an 80% surge in home prices, outshining Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru.

Why the Strait of Hormuz matters to India amid Israel-Iran tensionsThe Strait of Hormuz is located between Iran to the north and Oman and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to the south. It connects the Persian Gulf to the Gulf of Oman, and then to the Arabian Sea.

India's unemployment rate rises to 5.6% in May 2025Rural areas saw a considerable rise in unemployment among those aged 15–29, with the rate reaching 13.7% in May from 12.3% in April. The situation was similarly difficult for urban youth, where unemployment marginally increased to 17.9% from 17.2% the previous month.

Explained: Why Vishal Mega Mart shares crashed 8% todayDespite the drop, Vishal Mega Mart's shares have done well overall this year. They have risen 18% in 2025 so far, outperforming the Nifty index, which has given a return of 5% year-to-date. Since the company's listing, the stock has gained 12%.

Explained: Why fixed deposits are losing appeal among Indian householdsOnce the go-to option for safety-first savers, fixed deposits are steadily losing favour. Read on to know what's driving the shift.

Explained: Why Dalal Street hasn't panicked amid ongoing Iran–Israel conflictDespite war jitters and foreign outflows, domestic markets held firm. With retail inflows steady and domestic themes strong, is the buy-the-dip playbook still the smartest move?

WatchSalman Khan will be the first guest on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' Season 3, premiering June 21 on Netflix. Host Sonali Bendre says Pati, Patni Aur Panga is like a page of my marriageSonali Bendre is making a comeback as a TV host for the upcoming reality show 'Pati, Patni Aur Panga', featuring real-life celebrity couples in fun relationship challenges. Calling it a reflection of her own marriage, she said the show celebrates everyday moments that make love real.

Kajol on working equation with husband Ajay Devgn: We are not civilisedKajol opened up about working with husband Ajay Devgn, sharing how they openly call each other out on set but never cross boundaries. She also said she keeps a polite and professional attitude while shooting to maintain a comfortable work environment.

Nani to reunite with Hi Nanna director Shouryuv for pan-India rom-com: ReportNani is set to reunite with 'Hi Nanna' director Shouryuv for a light-hearted romantic comedy. The shooting for the film is expected to begin in 2026.

Justin Baldoni acquires rights to read Blake Lively-Taylor Swift's private chatsIn a recent development in the 'It Ends With Us' row, actor-filmmaker Justin Baldoni acquired the rights to access messages between actor Blake Lively and her singer friend Taylor Swift. Here's what it means.

DNA review: Atharvaa-Nimisha's film is a smart thriller with few unwanted detoursReleased-Fri Jun 20, 2025DNA movie review: Director Nelson Venkatesan's film, starring Atharvaa and Nimisha Sajayan, is a neatly crafted thriller about organised crime. The film boasts enough thrills with a few unwanted detours.

Kajol calls Hyderabad's Ramoji Film City haunted, leaves internet dividedKajol's remarks about Ramoji Film City being haunted have stirred controversy among Hyderabadis and internet users. While some dismiss it as superstition, others recall similar spooky experiences at the iconic film studio.

Madonna reacts to ties with Pope Leo XIV; Jolie, Bieber also among his relativesSinger-songwriter Madonna responded to a recent report suggesting she is related to Pope Leo XIV. The report also mentioned that several other celebrities have ties to the Vatican.

Ahmed Khan cites Pahalgam attack, Kashmir schedule for Welcome to the Jungle delay'Welcome to The Jungle' director Ahmed Khan clarified that they were scheduled to shoot in Kashmir this month, but had to let go of the location in the aftermath of the Pahalgam attack. His statement came when several reports suggested financial issues as the reason behind the delay in the film's shooting.

Nani calls Meiyazhagan absolute beauty, one of his favourite films of the decadeActor Nani calls 'Meiyazhagan' an absolute beauty and one of his favourite films of the decade. The film's emotional depth and personal storytelling have left a lasting impact on him amidst big-budget cinema.

Mannara Chopra pays final respect to her father, holds his photo close at prayer meetThe prayer meet for Mannara Chopra's father was held on Thursday. The actor appeared heartbroken as she held his photo close while the family visited a Gurudwara for the ceremony.

I knew Thugs of Hindostan would fail but Aditya Chopra didn't agree: Aamir KhanAamir Khan recalls telling Aditya Chopra that their film 'Thugs of Hindostan' needed changes for it to work for the audience, but none of them agreed with his feedback. The actor explains what went wrong with the film.

The multiplex owners emphasised Aamir's bold move and his belief in the magic of cinema.

Not Aamir Khan, Rajkummar Rao to play Ujjwal Nikam in film on 26/11: ReportMaddock Films is not producing a biopic on public prosecutor Ujjwal Nikam. Rajkummar Rao has been roped in to play the lead in the upcoming project.

Naga Chaitanya can't take his eyes off wife Sobhita as she enjoys dosaA video of Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala from Akhil Akkineni's wedding is going viral on social media. In the clip, Sobhita is seen enjoying the delicacies, while her husband looks completely smitten.

Aamir Khan on his father's tough love: His ring left marks on our facesAamir Khan opened up about his relationship with his parents, sharing that while his mother was always loving and calm, his bond with his father was more complex. However, he added that with time, they found peace before his father's death in 2010.

general news.headline: Location for decoding crashed Air India plane's black box to be decided: GovernmentThe government said it would take a call on the location regarding the decoding of the black box of the doomed Air India plane in Ahmedabad after a thorough assessment from all angles by the AAIB.

Shashi Tharoor admits differences with Congress leadership amid campaign snubSenior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said that while there are occasional differences with the party leadership, these issues should be resolved internally.

Cash row: These 'unnatural' behaviours of judge caught probe panel's attentionThe inquiry committee has found serious misconduct on the part of Justice Yashwant Varma, from whose residence a huge cash pile was found when a fire broke out there on March 14.

Live: Netanyahu doesn't rule out Khamenei's elimination, says all options openIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel and Iran continued to launch several missiles at each other for the seventh consecutive day. In a live address, Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei declared that the nation remains united and will not bow to external pressure. Responding to US President Donald Trump's call for Iran to surrender, Khamenei issued a stern warning that any American military strike would lead to "serious irreparable consequences". Trump, on whether the US will attack Iran, said, "I may do it, I may not do it. I mean, nobody knows what I'm going to do." Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

This Gulf War will BoomerangThe new Gulf war is a boomerang with worse aim than a drunk dart player and, like every misadventure from Kabul to Baghdad, is a masterclass in shooting your own foot while aiming for the moon.

India must grin and bear Trump, US is bigger than one man's egoTrump has once again proved he is deaf to facts and blind to reality in claiming US credit for the India-Pakistan ceasefire. He seemingly twisted the knife with his 'I love Pakistan' comment soon after meeting Asim Munir. It's a red flag for Indian diplomacy, and for now, India must swallow this bitter pill. Because Trump is temporary.

3-year jail term, Rs 5,000 fine: Karnataka proposes crowd control lawIn the wake of the tragic stampede during the RCB victory celebrations that claimed 11 lives, the Karnataka government has proposed a new legislation, Karnataka Crowd Control Bill, 2025.

What price is Pakistan's Field Marshal Munir paying for free lunch with Trump?Asim Munir wasn't the only one doing the signalling post-Operation Sindoor. PM Modi also ended weeks of avoiding a showdown with Trump, who had been taking credit for the ceasefire between India and Pakistan.

Video forensic suggests Khamenei may have moved away from residenceIn a forensics analysis, India Today's Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT) noticed unusual technical deviations in the production of the latest video as against previous videos released by his office.

Is ChatGPT making us dumb? MIT study says students are using their brains lessA new study suggests that AI tools like ChatGPT can gradually impact our ability to learn and quickly analyse information. Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu called it a dangerous precedent.

Sharad Pawar and Ajit to lock horns in sugar mill poll, make it prestige battleAjit Pawar, who is contesting a cooperative sugar mill election after 40 years, has declared that he would become the chairperson if he won the Malegaon Co-operative Sugar Factory poll.

Chilli Oil is the pantry's new 'it girl', and achaar might be jealousFrom our favourite Asian restaurants to our home kitchens, there's a new condiment quickly becoming indispensable: chilli oil.

Zia-Musharraf-Munir: Why the US needs Pakistan's dictatorsA 1947 British war memo shows why Pakistan, not India, suited post-imperial interests — creating a pliant state on Soviet, Iranian, and Arabian frontiers. In 2025, that logic still holds.

Inside Dimona: The secretive core of Israel's nuclear powerEven as Israel keeps its own nuclear arsenal shrouded in secrecy, it is actively striking targets linked to Iran, citing Tehran's advancing nuclear research as justification. Meanwhile, satellite imagery over the past five years has revealed major construction at Israel's Dimona facility, with experts suggesting upgrades or even the possible building of a new reactor to boost plutonium production.

Ben Stokes' warning for India: England do not fear Jasprit BumrahEngland Test captain Ben Stokes has said his team does not fear India's Jasprit Bumrah. He emphasised that winning a Test series depends on the entire team, not just one bowler.

Can this Ollie Pope plan help England neutralise Jasprit Bumrah?England vice-captain Ollie Pope has outlined his strategy to tackle Jasprit Bumrah in the first Test at Headingley. His plan focusses on rotating the strike to reduce Bumrah's impact.

Mukesh Kumar's cryptic Instagram story goes viral: Karma is unforgivableIndia fast bowler Mukesh Kumar shared a cryptic Instagram post just before the start of India's 1st Test against England. His message has raised questions about his omission and team dynamics ahead of the series.

Can KL Rahul step up in absence of Virat Kohli to lead India's charge vs England?India tour of England: With Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma absent, KL Rahul—now the senior-most batter in the side—finds himself as the pillar around which India's five-Test campaign in England must be built. This is his moment to step up, and with it comes the weight of expectation.

Gill's big Test: Leadership lessons from Graeme Smith's historic England tourShubman Gill will be having his toughest test as a cricketer as he officially takes over the leadership duties of the Indian Test team beginning from June 20. The Prince of Indian cricket can take a leaf out of Graeme Smith's book, who faced a similar challenge in the early days of his Test captaincy.

Chelsea's Mudryk faces potential four-year ban after FA doping chargeMykhailo Mudryk's career hangs in the balance as the Chelsea winger faces a possible four-year suspension following FA doping charges, marking a dramatic fall from grace for the €89 million signing.

Rohit Sharma gifts Ayush Mhatre signed bat ahead of India U-19's England tourIn a heartwarming post on social media, Ayush Mhatre revealed that he got a signed bat from Rohit Sharma as a gift on Wednesday, June 18. Mhatre will be leading the Indian U-19 team for their tour of England.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
